value.title: Power BI DAX for Beginners: AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX
value.excerpt: Welcome to the complete Power BI DAX Beginner Series. During this session, we will discuss the AVERAGE function in DAX. AVERAGE function in Power BI DAX has lots of variations. During this session, we will cover AVERAGE, AVERAGEA, AVERAGEX. So, Let's get started!  The Episode covers the following information:

value.title: 4 Troubleshooting connectivity tips with the gateway
value.excerpt: This video was based on a call I had last week relating to troubleshooting connectivity to a SQL Server named instance from the Power BI gateway. value.title: A TWIST on dynamically filtering visuals by a slicer in Power BI

value.title: Combining refresh and real time with Hybrid Tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tired of having to wait for the next refresh to see current data in your Power BI Report? Hybrid Tables is here to help you! Patrick looks at how you can use this feature to have an imported table that uses DirectQuery for the most recent data that hasn't been imported yet. BANANAS!  Announcement Blog:

value.title: Debugging a slow Power BI report with Phil Seamark
value.excerpt: Phil sits down with us to walk through his process in debugging a slow Power BI report. This uses some new features in Power BI Desktop as well as using DAX Studio to get further insights.  Connect with Phil Twitter: https://twitter.com/PhilSeamark Blog: https://dax.tips/   Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: Do we need more Power BI Premium Capacity?
value.excerpt: Capacity planning for Power BI Premium is not an exact science. How much capacity do you need? As with most things, it depends! Adam walks through some things to consider when thinking about your planning.  Premium Gen2 capacity load evaluation https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-concepts

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)

value.title: Parameters and Templates with Power BI Desktop

This is great for when you are creating a report, and need to share it with a customer that may have a different name for the server

value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the On-Premises Data Gateway. What is it exactly? This can be used with more than just Power BI. This includes PowerApps, Microsoft Flow, Azure Analysis Services and more. The entire Power Platform!   If you found this video helpful, we have a free cheat sheet for you for more

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/
